schedule.name: sch6
schedule.heading: Transitional and Savings Provisions for Medical Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2018

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: amended Ordinance (《經修訂條例》) means this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance;
Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Medical Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2018 (15 of 2018);

pre-amended Disciplinary Regulation (《原有紀律處分規例》) means the Medical Practitioners (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulation (Cap. 161 sub. leg. E) as in force immediately before the commencement;
pre-amended Electoral Regulation (《原有選舉規例》) means the Medical Practitioners (Electoral Provisions) (Procedure) Regulation (Cap. 161 sub. leg. B) as in force immediately before the commencement;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Filling vacancy in office of member of Council under section 3(5B)(b) of pre-amended Ordinance
section.content: If, immediately before the commencement, the Secretary has sent an invitation under section 8 of the pre-amended Electoral Regulation, then section 3(5B)(b) of the pre-amended Ordinance and section 8 of that Regulation continue to apply in relation to a nomination of candidate made pursuant to the invitation.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Assessors appointed under section 21B(2)(a) to (e) of pre-amended Ordinance
section.content: If, immediately before the commencement, the term of office of an assessor appointed under section 21B(2)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) of the pre-amended Ordinance has not yet expired, then, on and after the commencement, the assessor is taken to be holding office under section 20BC(4) of the amended Ordinance for the remainder of the term.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Assessors appointed under section 21B(2)(f) of pre-amended Ordinance
section.content: If, immediately before the commencement, the term of office of an assessor appointed under section 21B(2)(f) of the pre-amended Ordinance has not yet expired, then, on and after the commencement, the assessor is taken to be holding office under section 20BB(4) of the amended Ordinance for the remainder of the term.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Former PIC deemed as PIC under amended Ordinance for existing cases

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Secretary has submitted any complaint, information or matter to the chairman or the deputy chairman of the former PIC under section 6 of the pre-amended Disciplinary Regulation (existing case); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: immediately before the commencement—

subparagraph.content: a decision has not yet been made to dismiss the existing case, or to refer it to the Health Committee or to direct that it be investigated further under section 6(3), (4) or (5) of the pre-amended Disciplinary Regulation;

the chairman or the deputy chairman of the former PIC has directed that the existing case be referred to the former PIC under section 9(1) or 10(1) of the pre-amended Disciplinary Regulation for its consideration (existing direction), and a decision has not yet been made under section 11(8) or (9) of that Regulation in respect of the existing case; or

the Chairman has, under section 15(1) of the pre-amended Disciplinary Regulation, referred the existing case back to the former PIC for further consideration, and a decision has not yet been made under section 11(8) or (9) of that Regulation in respect of the existing case.

subsection.leadIn: The members of the former PIC (existing members) may continue to consider the existing case on and after the commencement as if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: each existing member were appointed as a member of the deemed PIC for the remainder of his or her term of office with the former PIC (unexpired term); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the chairman and the deputy chairman of the former PIC were appointed as the chairman and the deputy chairman respectively of the deemed PIC.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2)(a), an existing member may not continue to consider any existing case beyond the expiry of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: his or her unexpired term; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the member is reappointed as a member of the deemed PIC, the term of office for which the member is reappointed.

subsection.leadIn: On and after the commencement, the provisions of this Ordinance, other than sections 20BA(5) and 20S(1), (1A), (2), (2A), (3) and (5), apply in relation to the deemed PIC, the existing members and the consideration of the existing cases—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for all purposes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the same way as they apply in relation to a Preliminary Investigation Committee established under section 20S(1) of the amended Ordinance, its members and a case considered by that Committee.

subsection.content: Anything validly done before the commencement by or in relation to the former PIC, its chairman or deputy chairman or the existing members in respect of any existing case is, on and after the commencement, taken to have been done by or in relation to the deemed PIC or its chairman, deputy chairman or members in respect of the case.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the existing cases are taken to have been submitted to the chairman or the deputy chairman of the deemed PIC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an existing direction is taken to be a direction to refer an existing case to the deemed PIC.

subsection.content: Sections 20BA(5) and 20S(1), (2), (3) and (5) of the pre-amended Ordinance apply in relation to the deemed PIC as if those sections had not been amended by the Amendment Ordinance, and accordingly, if the office of any member of the deemed PIC becomes vacant, the person appointed by the Council to fill the vacancy must be of the category described in section 20S(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance to which the member belongs.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Referral of existing cases back to PIC on or after commencement

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an existing case (within the meaning of section 5(1)(a) of this Schedule) has been referred by the former PIC to the Council for an inquiry under section 21 of the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the case falls within the description of section 7(1)(b) or 9(1)(b)(i) of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If the chairperson of an inquiry panel exercises the power under section 15(1)(a) of the amended Regulation to refer the case back to a Preliminary Investigation Committee (PIC) by virtue of section 7(2)(b) of this Schedule, or the chairperson of the deemed panel (within the meaning of section 9(2)(a) of this Schedule) exercises that power by virtue of section 9(3) of this Schedule, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the deemed PIC (within the meaning of section 5(2)(a) of this Schedule) is taken to be the PIC to which the case is referred back; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 5 (other than section 5(1) and (6)) of this Schedule applies for all purposes in relation to the further consideration of the case by the deemed PIC.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Council’s inquiry yet to commence under section 21 of pre-amended Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a case has been referred by the former PIC to the Council for an inquiry under section 21 of the pre-amended Ordinance (former PIC’s decision); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the commencement, no meeting has been held in accordance with section 21B of the pre-amended Ordinance for the purpose of conducting the inquiry.

subsection.leadIn: The former PIC’s decision is taken to be a decision referred to in section 20T(2A) of the amended Ordinance, and the Council is taken to have received a notification referred to in section 20X(1) of the amended Ordinance, and accordingly, on and after the commencement—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the provisions of this Ordinance apply for all purposes in relation to the further conduct (including the inquiry) of the case.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Council’s inquiry yet to commence under section 26 of pre-amended Ordinance
section.leadIn: If the Court of Appeal has remitted a case under section 26(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance to the Council for another inquiry and immediately before the commencement, the inquiry has not yet commenced, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Council must appoint an inquiry panel for the inquiry under section 20X(1) of the amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provisions of this Ordinance apply for all purposes in relation to the further conduct (including the inquiry) of the case.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Ongoing Council inquiry commenced under section 21 of pre-amended Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: immediately before the commencement—

subparagraph.content: a meeting has been held in accordance with section 21B of the pre-amended Ordinance for the purpose of conducting the inquiry and no decision or order has been made under section 21(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance;

subparagraph.leadIn: a decision or order has been made by the Council under section 21(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance and—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: no review is taking place under section 21(4B) of that Ordinance and the period for reviewing the decision or order under that section has not yet expired; or

subparagraph.name: B

subparagraph.content: the Court of Appeal has remitted a case under section 26(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance to the Council for an, or another, inquiry, and the inquiry has commenced but has not yet been concluded; or
the Court of Appeal has remitted a case under section 26(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance to the Council for an inquiry, and the inquiry has not yet commenced.

subsection.leadIn: Despite sections 3 and 4 of this Schedule, on and after the commencement, the members of the Council and (if applicable) assessors who, immediately before the commencement, have conducted the inquiry, or have been conducting the inquiry or review (inquirers), may continue to conduct the inquiry or review (including a review that commences before the expiry of the period referred to in subsection (1)(b)(ii)(A)) as an inquiry panel, and may do so beyond the expiry of their term of office, as if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the inquirer who performed the function of the president of the meeting held in accordance with section 21B of the pre-amended Ordinance were appointed as the chairperson of the deemed panel under section 20X(3) of the amended Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: On and after the commencement, the provisions of this Ordinance apply in relation to the deemed panel, the inquirers and the inquiry or review of the case—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for all purposes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the same way as they apply in relation to an inquiry panel, its members and an inquiry or review under section 21 of the amended Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the deemed panel may exercise any of the powers under section 21(1) of the amended Ordinance and may review its decision or order under section 21(4B) of the amended Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
paragraph.content: sections 13A, 15, 16, 17 and 18 and Part IV of the amended Regulation apply in relation to the inquiry conducted by the deemed panel; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: section 13A of the amended Regulation applies in relation to the review conducted by the deemed panel.

subsection.content: Anything validly done before the commencement by or in relation to the inquirers as the Council conducting the inquiry or review is, on and after the commencement, taken to have been done by or in relation to the deemed panel.

Without limiting subsection (5), a matter referred to the Ethics Committee by the inquirers under section 21(2A) of the pre-amended Ordinance is, on and after the commencement, taken to have been referred to that Committee by the deemed panel under section 20Y(a) of the amended Ordinance.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Remittal of cases on or after commencement for inquiry by deemed panel
section.leadIn: If the Court of Appeal, by virtue of section 11(3) of this Schedule, exercises its power to remit a case referred to in section 11(1) or (2) of this Schedule under section 26(1A)(b)(i) of the amended Ordinance to an inquiry panel for holding a new inquiry, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the deemed panel (within the meaning of section 9(2)(a) of this Schedule) is taken to be the inquiry panel to which the case is remitted; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 9 (other than section 9(1) and (6)) of this Schedule applies for all purposes in relation to the further conduct of the case by the deemed panel.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of an existing case (within the meaning of section 5(1)(a) of this Schedule), an order was made by the Council under section 21 of the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the commencement, an appeal has been made to the Court of Appeal against the order under section 26(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance,

subsection.continued: then, on and after the commencement, the appeal is taken to be made under section 26(1A) of the amended Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of an existing case (within the meaning of section 5(1)(a) of this Schedule), an order was made by the Council under section 21 of the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the commencement, the period provided in section 26(3) of the pre-amended Ordinance for an appeal to be made under section 26(1) of that Ordinance against the order has not yet expired,

subsection.continued: then, on and after the commencement, an appeal against the order may be made under section 26(1A) of the amended Ordinance as if the order were an order made by an inquiry panel.

subsection.content: On and after the commencement, the provisions of this Ordinance apply for all purposes in relation to the further conduct (including any appeal or remittal) of the case referred to in subsection (1) or (2).
